introduction.para: You can quickly copy your chart to another application by saving it as a picture. This also prevents people from editing your chart.

alert.para: You can also copy an Excel chart to another Office application.

introduction.para: Follow these steps to save a chart as a picture:

listItem.para: Click the chart that you want to save as a picture.
On the Home tab > Copy. Or, right-click over the chart and choose Copy from the popup menu.
On the Home tab, click the arrow under Paste > Paste Special.
In the Paste Special box, in the As list, click the graphic file format that you want.
Right-click over the graphic and choose Save as Picture.
Enter a name for your graphic file, browse to the location to save the file, and then click Save.

introduction.para: TIP: In PowerPoint, you can right-click the chart and choose Save as Picture. There's no need to copy it as a picture first.

TD.para: Graphics created in one program are displayed in another program exactly the way they appeared in the original program.
Supports 256 colors and no image data is lost when the file is compressed.
Best used for pictures with many colors, such as scanned photos.
Improves the quality of graphics on a web site because parts of the image can be transparent and brightness can be controlled.
